channel.title: BIOS2 Education resources
channel.description: Educational materials, incluing links to pdfs, videos, and code to reproduce all of our trainings.

item.title: (un)Reproducibility Detox
item.dc:creator: Gracielle Higino
item.description: A seven-day detox routine to improve the reproducibility of your projects!

item.title: Point-count Data Analysis
item.dc:creator: Peter Solymos
item.description: Analysis of point-count data in the presence of variable survey methodologies and detection error offered by Peter Solymos to BIOS2 Fellows in March 2021.

item.title: Introduction aux concepts EDI en contexte scientifique
item.dc:creator: Agathe Riallan
Marie-José Naud
item.description: Une courte introduction aux concepts de l'EDI dans un contexte scientifique.

item.title: Introduction to EDI concepts in a scientific context
item.dc:creator: Marie-José Naud
Agathe Riallan
item.description: A short introduction to EDI concepts in a scientific context.

item.title: 4-Day Training in Spatial Statistics with Philippe Marchand
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Training session about statistical analysis of spatial data in ecology, hosted by Philippe Marchand (UQAT). | Session de formation sur l’analyse statistique des données spatiales en écologie, animée par Pr. Philippe Marchand (UQAT).

item.title: Making websites with HUGO, Part 2
item.dc:creator: Dominique Gravel
Guillaume Larocque
item.description: This workshop provides a general introduction to HUGO, a popular open source framework for building websites without requiring a knowledge of HTML/CSS or web programming.

item.title: Making websites with HUGO, Part 1
item.dc:creator: Dominique Gravel
Guillaume Larocque
item.description: This workshop provides a general introduction to HUGO, a popular open source framework for building websites without requiring a knowledge of HTML/CSS or web programming.

item.title: Data Visualization
item.dc:creator: Alex Arkilanian
Katherine Hébert
item.description: General principles of visualization and graphic design, and techniques of tailored visualization. This training was developed and delivered by Alex Arkilanian and Katherine Hébert on September 21st and 22nd, 2020.

item.title: Science Communication
item.dc:creator: Gracielle Higino
Katherine Hébert
item.description: Recordings, content and handouts from a 6-hour Science Communication workshop held over two days on 15 and 16 June 2020.

item.title: Sensibilisation aux réalités autochtones et recherche collaborative, partie 2
item.dc:creator: Dr Catherine-Alexandra Gagnon
item.description: Série de deux webinaires sur la sensibilisation aux réalités autochtones et la recherche en collaboration avec les Autochtones, offert du 28 au 30 avril 2020 par Catherine-Alexandra Gagnon, PhD.

item.title: Sensibilisation aux réalités autochtones et recherche collaborative, partie 1
item.dc:creator: Dr Catherine-Alexandra Gagnon
item.description: Série de deux webinaires sur la sensibilisation aux réalités autochtones et la recherche en collaboration avec les Autochtones, offert du 28 au 30 avril 2020 par Catherine-Alexandra Gagnon, PhD.

item.title: Mathematical Modeling in Ecology and Evolution
item.dc:creator: Dr Sarah P. Otto
item.description: This workshop will introduce participants to the logic behind modeling in biology, focusing on developing equations, finding equilibria, analyzing stability, and running simulations.Techniques will be illustrated with the software tools, Mathematica and Maxima. This workshop was held in two parts: January 14 and January 16, 2020.
